result.execSummary:
The defendant Gerilyn M Matthews was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing 11/1/22 or civil judgment enter for non payment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gerilyn M Matthews

records.addlTxt:
10:35 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder.
Defendant Gerilyn M Matthews not in court.  Attorney Aaron R Anderson in court for Gerilyn M Matthews. 
Attorney appears by authorization. 
Prosecuting attorney moves to amend to Disorderly Conduct contrary to section 13.102(c)(8)  of the Waukesha County Code of Ordinances.  Court approves amendment.  Guilty plea entered.  Court finds the defendant guilty.
Court orders the following:
$267.50 to be paid at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing 11/1/22 or civil judgment entered subject to collections, as penalty for non payment of fine.

9:00 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. Defendant Gerilyn M Matthews not in court.  Attorney Aaron R Anderson in court for Gerilyn M Matthews. Attorney appears by authorization. 
Atty Anderson requests time to speak to assigned ADA in this matter, but anticipates a amendment in this matter. 
Court sets a plea and sentencing in this matter.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

Attorney Hughes appears as friend of the court.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
